page.title: 02Coleford May Day Gala
page.content: The {Gala}was held on May 6th at Highbury playing fields in Coleford. The{May Day Gala}opened at 2.00pm when they crowned the {May Queen }and her attendants. There were lots of stalls. One of the stalls was called Aunt Sally. You paid 10p for balls and you had to throw the balls at china cups, plates, jugs, etc....It was good fun smashing all the plates and things but you didn't win anything. Just a little way down from the Aunt Sally there were the skittles and if you knocked down 9 skittles you won 50p and if you knocked down more than 9 skittles you won Â£1.00. The brownies were doing the cake stall. It was good fun at the May Day Gala because there were lots of stalls to look at and play on.All the money that we raised was going to the scout hall.{
